cast.overview: The story of Operation Market Garden—a failed attempt by the allies in the latter stages of WWII to end the war quickly by securing three bridges in Holland allowing access over the Rhine into Germany. A combination of poor allied intelligence and the presence of two crack German panzer divisions meant that the final part of this operation (the bridge in Arnhem over the Rhine) was doomed to failure.
cast.title: A Bridge Too Far

details.biography: Timothy Morand was an actor who had a successful Hollywood career. Morand began his career with roles in the Dirk Bogarde drama "A Bridge Too Far" (1977), "Les Miserables" (CBS, 1978-79) and "From a Far Country: Pope John Paul II" (NBC, 1981-82). Later, he acted in "Ivanhoe" (1981-82), "The Hunchback of Notre Dame" (CBS, 1981-82) and "Fire & Steel" (1989). He also appeared in "The Secret Agent" (PBS, 1992-93) and "Diana: A Tribute to the People's Princess" (TNT, 1998-99). More recently, Morand acted on "Law & Order: UK" (BBC, 2008-2013).
details.name: Timothy Morand
